newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-AC MILAN BEAT CHELSEA 2-0 IN FRIENDLY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-AC MILAN BEAT CHELSEA 2-0 IN FRIENDLY.

text.p: France's Christophe Dugarry scored twice to give AC Milan a 2-0 win over English premier league club Chelsea in a friendly on Wednesday.

Chelsea, with Italian forward Gianfranco Zola and midfielder Paul Hughes in fine form, dominated most of the first half but fell behind in the ninth minute when Dugarry scored from a Michael Reiziger cross.
The English side could have equalised six minutes later but Sebastiano Rossi blocked two close-range shots and Hughes then managed to hit the bar with a header, with Rossi clearly beaten.
Dugarry headed in the second goal in the 62nd minute after both sides had made several changes.
Chelsea player-coach Ruud Gullit came on in defence. The Dutchman, who spent six highly successful seasons at Milan, had Chelsea's best chance in the second half but shot high from close range.
